item.title: Firm Behavior and the Organization of Industry
item.description: The Costs of Production The goal of firms is to maximize profit, which equals total revenue minus total cost. When analyzing a firmâ€™s behavior, it is important to include all the opportunity costs of production. Some of the opportunity costs, such as the wages a firm pays its workers, are explicit. Other opportunity costs, such as the wages the firm owner gives up by working at the firm rather than taking another job, are implicit.
